page.title: 13PIG FARMING DRINKSTONE
page.content: My Dad works on Mr. Clarke's pig farm. It covers 40 acres and 8 men work there. They have 3,000 pigs. The breeds are Large White, Landrace and Essex. The pigs come in at 20 weeks. They eat potatoes, vegetable waste and apples. They are sold at 34 weeks to Haverhill Meat Ltd. The meat goes to Sainsburys. The Tractor Collection at the Pig Farm. My Dad collects old tractors. He has eight. He has one loader and two ploughs. They are Fordsons, Nuffields and Fergusons. They were made between 1947 and 1955. The oldest is a 1947 Fordson. He collects them from farms all round. He repairs and paints them. All of them are in working condition. Our whole school walked over the fields to draw his tractors. My Mum gave the children biscuits and a drink.
